> Why is it that if two tests overflow the stack, the
> AWT and Swing test runners crash?  Surely this is
> a bug. Here is an example that causes a crash:


I executed your test but couldn't get these tests to crash the 
application.  I have tested the SwingUI and TextUI.

With the TextUI, I have the following result:

test:
     [java] .........................................
     [java] .........................................
     [java] ..............E
     [java] Time: 2.434
     [java] There was 1 error:
     [java] 1) testInfRecursion(junit.tests.OverflowTest)
     [java] java.lang.StackOverflowError
     [java]     at junit.tests.OverflowTest.infiniteRecursion(OverflowTest.java:21)

                [...]
     [java]     at junit.tests.OverflowTest.infiniteRecursion(OverflowTest.java:21)

      [java]
      [java] FAILURES!!!
      [java] Tests run: 96,  Failures: 0,  Errors: 1
      [java]
      [java] Java Result: -1

You need to provide additional information so that I can reproduce the bug.

-Vladimir
